children.value: File-Sys-Cache is an npm package that provides a simple and efficient system files-based caching solution for Node.js applications.
Store data in the cache with options to specify file name prefix, file name, payload, and time-to-live (TTL).
Retrieve cached data by providing the corresponding file name or prefix.
Automatically invalidate cached data for items with expired TTLs.
Flush cache entries that match a given regular expression.
Clear the entire cache, removing all stored entries.
Monitor cache usage and performance statistics, including invalidated files count, logs over time, size over time, and request count.

contents.title: Getting Started
contents.description: File-Sys-Cache is an npm package that provides a simple and efficient system files-based caching solution for Node.js applications.

children.value: File-Sys-Cache is an npm package that provides a simple and efficient system files-based caching solution for Node.js applications.
ðŸ›ˆ Node 20.x or greater is preferred

html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}
Directory where cache will be stored
Auto invalidate files from file-system and delete expired files automatically without need of triggering .invalidate()
Enabled monitoring which exposes cache.monitoring.get(), cache.monitoring.reset()

props.code:
const data = await cache.get({ fileName: 'myFileName', key: 'myUniqueKey' });
// Gets cached data as: {"id":1,"name":"John","surname":"Doe"}

await cache.flushAll();
// Deletes all cached files

children.value: // or for multiple matches in file name

props.code:
await cache.set({ fileName: 'myFileName', key: 'myUniqueKey', payload: myPayload }) // Will delete
await cache.set({ fileName: 'myFileName', key: 'myUniqueKey', payload: myPayload }) // Will delete
await cache.set({ fileName: 'myFileNameDifferent', key: 'myUniqueKey', payload: myPayload }) // Will not delete
await cache.flushByRegex('myFileName');

links.text: Option enableMonitoring is set to true
